title: Propulsion Assignment
description:
This assignment focuses on analyzing different propulsion systems used in aerospace applications. Students will explore the efficiency, thrust generation, and fuel consumption of various engines.

Key Topics:
- Basic principles of propulsion and Newton’s third law
- Types of propulsion systems: jet engines, rockets, and ion propulsion
- Thrust equation and specific impulse calculations
- Comparative efficiency of chemical and electric propulsion

Instructions:
1. Research and compare different propulsion technologies.
2. Provide a case study on a real-world propulsion system.
3. Perform calculations on thrust and specific impulse for a given engine.
4. Write a technical report summarizing findings and recommendations.

title: Combustion Analysis
description:
This assignment explores the fundamental principles of combustion as applied to aerospace propulsion. The goal is to analyze combustion efficiency, heat release, and emissions.

Key Topics:
- Thermodynamics of combustion reactions
- Stoichiometric ratios and air-fuel mixtures
- Energy output and efficiency calculations
- Environmental impact and emission control

Instructions:
1. Explain the combustion process in a selected propulsion system.
2. Analyze air-fuel ratios for optimal performance.
3. Perform energy output calculations for a given fuel type.
4. Submit a detailed report discussing findings and possible optimizations.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description:
In this project, students will design and analyze a rocket nozzle to maximize thrust and efficiency. The focus is on the physics of nozzle expansion and flow behavior.

Key Topics:
- Nozzle geometry and design principles
- Supersonic and subsonic flow regions
- Expansion ratio and efficiency considerations
- Computational simulation of flow patterns

Instructions:
1. Design a nozzle that optimizes thrust.
2. Perform flow analysis using CFD software.
3. Calculate expansion ratios and velocity profiles.
4. Document the design process and justify decisions.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description:
This quiz tests knowledge of fundamental aerodynamics, covering airflow behavior and forces acting on an aircraft.

Key Topics:
- Lift, drag, and aerodynamic forces
- Bernoulli’s principle and airflow velocity
- Pressure distribution around an airfoil
- Boundary layers and flow separation

Instructions:
1. Answer multiple-choice and short-answer questions.
2. Solve aerodynamic force calculations.
3. Interpret airflow diagrams and graphs.
4. Submit responses before the deadline.

title: Flow Analysis
description:
This assignment requires analyzing fluid flow over aerodynamic surfaces. Students will use theoretical and computational methods to evaluate flow properties.

Key Topics:
- Navier-Stokes equations and fluid dynamics
- Turbulent vs. laminar flow
- Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations
- Flow visualization techniques

Instructions:
1. Choose an airfoil and analyze its airflow.
2. Perform CFD simulations to predict lift and drag.
3. Compare theoretical and simulated results.
4. Write a comprehensive report on findings.

title: Heating Analysis
description:
This assignment focuses on heat transfer analysis in aerospace structures, including conduction, convection, and radiation.

Key Topics:
- Heat transfer equations and thermal conductivity
- Temperature gradients in high-speed flight
- Thermal protection systems in spacecraft
- Heat dissipation techniques

Instructions:
1. Analyze heat distribution in an aerospace component.
2. Use software tools to model thermal effects.
3. Calculate heat flux and thermal efficiency.
4. Submit a report with design recommendations.

title: Structural Design Task
description:
This assignment involves designing a structural component for aerospace applications, ensuring it meets strength and weight requirements.

Key Topics:
- Material selection and structural integrity
- Load distribution and stress analysis
- Finite element analysis (FEA) for structural testing
- Aerospace industry safety standards

Instructions:
1. Design a structural component for a specific application.
2. Perform stress analysis using FEA.
3. Justify material selection based on weight and strength.
4. Provide a final report with design details.

title: Orbital Calculations
description:
This assignment covers the mathematical principles of orbital mechanics. Students will calculate satellite orbits and predict trajectories.

Key Topics:
- Kepler’s laws and orbital motion
- Orbital parameters and transfer calculations
- Hohmann transfer and delta-v analysis
- Gravity assists and mission planning

Instructions:
1. Calculate orbital parameters for a satellite.
2. Determine transfer orbits and fuel requirements.
3. Solve problems involving orbital perturbations.
4. Submit a mathematical analysis of results.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description:
This exam assesses knowledge of systems engineering principles in aerospace projects, focusing on requirements, design, and project management.

Key Topics:
- System architecture and requirements analysis
- Risk assessment and mitigation strategies
- Lifecycle management and cost analysis
- Integration of subsystems in aerospace design

Instructions:
1. Answer theoretical and practical questions.
2. Provide solutions to system integration challenges.
3. Apply engineering principles to case studies.
4. Complete the exam within the allotted time.
